thread.title: Watch The Girl From 'The Ring' Scare The Sh*t Out Of Customers
thread.title_full: Watch The Girl From 'The Ring' Scare The Sh*t Out Of Customers

author: Joel Balsam
title: Watch The Girl From 'The Ring' Scare The Sh*t Out Of Customers
text:
'Rings' Girl Pranks Customers By Crawling Out Of The TV © Paramount Pictures 'Rings' Girl Pranks Customers By Crawling Out Of The TV Trending News: Watch The Girl From 'The Ring' Scare The Sh*t Out Of Customers Shares Quick Take 
It has been 15 years since that creepy black-haired girl crawled out of the TV and into our nightmares. Fifteen years is a long time, so maybe you'd think something like that wouldn't scare you now. Nope, definitely still scary — especially if the girl surprised you IRL. 
In a promo for Rings, a sequel that takes place 13 years after the events of the first movie, Paramount coordinated a little prank in a TV store. 
Pretty surprising that nobody in the store had a heart attack, cause that's some terrifying sh*t. 
The Rings plot is as follows: "A young woman becomes worried about her boyfriend when he explores a dark subculture surrounding a mysterious videotape said to kill the watcher seven days after he has viewed it. She sacrifices herself to save her boyfriend and in doing so makes a horrifying discovery: there is a “movie within the movie” that no one has ever seen before." 
Hoo damn, here we go again. 
For anyone willing to have this creepy girl haunt their dreams, Rings will debut in theaters on February 3rd. Drop This Fact 
Daveigh Chase, the actress in the original movie, isn't as creepy as the girl she plays. She's actually quite the looker. A photo posted by Daveigh (@daveighc) on Jul 18, 2013 at 3:17pm PDT Show comments
